112.content: Pearl paced about the top fountain structure in her room in thought. Sure it had been months since her last attempt at 'dreaming', but the more she thought about it the more it confused her. Such a simple action bringing forth such an odd branch of pictures into a big....what did Steven call them...mixed up movie. Of course while it all appeared to be chaos, she did have some form of control over the whole experience. That might of explained why....she was there...of course it was only her body and Greg was the head and his mouth.... Pearl slapped herself as if it would help get the image out of her head. There was no way she could train herself with these thoughts racing about her. Looking to the fountain at her feet. Pearl took a deep breath. "Now lets see...lay down...okay...now..close my eyes....yes...now *yawn* don't think about.....anything...." Minutes passed by minutes as Pearl tossed herself about, not knowing if she was in the optimum position. "Uggh....this is so pointless..." As Pearl opened her eyes, she found herself in.....
112.title: To the 'mixed up movies'

113.content: Pearl watched as Connie slashed through the holograms with speed and precision. Her skills with a sword had become quite impressive over the past months. It was almost like she didn't even need to be here, Connie could run through the motions all by herself. Of course, deep down inside, Pearl couldn't help but worry about the girl. There was after all more to being a warrior than having skills with a sword. A warrior and guard had to have a strong mind as well as a strong stance in order to protect thier superior. Of course she understood Connie and Steven saw themselves as equals but the truth of the matter was that Connie needed to understand the mental tasking as well as the physical. Besides, if Steven's stories about Connie and her fears were to be believed then it was clear she needed to be improved. The question was, just how to go about it all? While gems knew about the art of simple hypnosis, Homeworld had tried to keep it's use to the lowest of minimums and Rose was no different. However Pearl did remember a few interrogation spells she saw a few gems try during the rebellion. Of course maybe it would be best to ask Garnet over the whole affair. After all, she new about mental cleansing better than her. Then again...there....no....well...there was this one weapon she had taken from some Homeworld scientists in the final days of the war...if it could work the way she heard.....but....no...maybe....

"Connie, I need to go check on something. Just keep practicing your strikes." "Yes mam." Connie said without even turning about. Pearl took a moment of hesitation before heading to the warp pad, still worried about just what she was about to do. Sure there was a good reason but she had no idea how this device really worked anyhow. As the she warped into the temple, Pearl found herself welcomed by a quiet home. Steven was visiting Peridot and Lapis and Amethyst was most likely in her room. As for Garnet....well...who knew where she was. Her gem and the door glowed before the latter opened up to the fountains and elegance of her room.
"Are you certain that is what they told you Pearl?" "Yes, well..they said something along the lines. All it shows is how desperate Homeworld is." Pearl watched as Rose carried the concealed weapon across the water, unable to see the gem's face through her hair. "Pearl, do the others know about this?"
"No, I made certain I told only you." The two gems came to a halt atop the largest of the bowl fountains as Rose bubbled the device. "To rob one of thier ability to truley think for themselves. If they had finished this machine...." Pearl saw the tears dropping to the floor and for a moment, didn't say a word. "Rose, can I ask why we are not destroying the weapon?
I don't want to question you but is it really safe to keep it..." Before Pearl could finish her sentence, Rose shot the bubble downward into the water. When the bubble vanished from sight, Rose turned directly toward her dear Pearl. "Promise me Pearl, promise me that whether we win or lose the war, you will never forget this weapon is here. It is to be a reminder of what this could have come to, the ends that some will go to destroy the will of another."

Pearl watched as the bubble came into view, her flashback not helping her questioning over the morality of her choice. The bubble exited the water, seeming as clear and as set as the day it was made. Pearl's hand twitched as she held it out to pop the bubble. She wasn't meaning to destroy Connie' s will though, only to help it. As the bubble popped, the rather small and covered device fell into Pearl's other waiting hand. Uncovering the cloth, Pearl gazed upon the object in her hands and examined it for the first time in thousands of years. The device was similar in shape to a gun, though more rounded out. Two light dials were etched into the sides of it's handles with a simple trigger. Though what it fired was rather a mystery to Pearl as she never really saw it in action.

But there is something you told me about myself that I really need to exercise more. I am who I am and I dictate my own actions. Not you, not Steven, not Homeworld customs and not even Rose. You might be right about this being wrong, but I want to show you that with the right help it won't have to be." Garnet began to rush Pearl, her future vision telling her what Pearl was about to do. With a flick of the trigger, the gun became active. A small, purple pellet fired from the tip at high velocity, hitting Garnet square in the chest.

For a moment, Pearl stood over Garnet with a slick smile of success. That smile however was soon replaced by the anxious expression one would expect to give at such a time. Her breathing was quick and her mind raced to find an excuse for this action. She stated at the weapon in hand, dials and all and looked back to the fallen Garnet. "Garnet...are you alright?"

After a few moments though, Pearl began to notice that Garnet had yet to get up from her position on the floor. It also didn't help that Garnet hadn't spoken out about Pearl's actions. She just layed there still without even a single moan. "Umm....Garnet? Is everything alright?" "It seems fine to me, but what matters is it you think everything is fine.....so do you?" Pearl looked once more to the weapon of control in her hands and sighed. "How could they be? I just shot you with a weapon ment to enslave other gems out of self defense in a completely selfish desire to hypnotize someone I cared about....to force them to obey me." "Seems fine to me my Pearl."

Pearl took a step back with that remark, it was clear now that the device had indeed taken control of Garnet but the way she spoke...a Pearl in charge. While she had long forgone the ways of the average Pearl, it was beyond strange to hear herself being addressed like a higher noble. "Um...you can get up Garnet." "I know, I am just trying to refocus myself in my new purpose." "And what would that be?" As Garnet began to get herself off the stone, she looked Pearl in the eyes and said "Serving you." Pearl's eyes couldn't leave Garnet for a moment, the realization of what was happening finally coming to light. She now had total control over Garnet, a fusion who (for the most part) is highly capable of focus and self control. If she could take control of her then Connie would be a snap. A small pang of concise came to Pearl as she realized what she thought. Garnet began to step forward with her usual mysterious look. "My Pearl, you're worried about what you are about to do I suppose?" Pearl nodded slowly, not sure if that was the problem or something else. "Don't be, I can see so many outcomes of your success and all of them end exactly how you would like." "And the ones where I don't....." "....Connie will understand, and so will the others. You have nothing to lose." After one more deep breath, a gleam came to Pearl's eye as she headed for the the door out of her room. info.description:
So, how about them Crystal Gems huh? Strong, bold, courageous...so many fine qualities to admire and appreciate about them. But, what if these amazing warriors were to undergo some...interesting changes? That's what we're here for! To explore odd and fascinating stories staring the female Gems in wacky antics across Beach City and beyond!

A few basic rules to make this the best experience it can be for everyone:

1. Grammar and syntax are important, please don't forget to spellcheck / proofread your writing.

2. Nobody likes a one sentence entry, so be cool and write about a paragraph or two per entry. People will appreciate you for it.

3. While there can be plenty of great ideas, a story has to start eventually. Let's be courteous and not create a never-ending tree of "But what about this?"
i. To compound on that, don't be afraid to end a story if it seems like there's little left to explore.

4. Just a few Okay / Not Okay things to explore:

Okay:
*Inflation (excluding muscle/eye/nose/ears/things along this line)
*Transformation (within reason)
*Hypnosis

Not okay:
*Vore / Preg
*Bodily Fluids
*Slob
*Torture
*Male

If you don't see something you'd like to write on, feel free to ask. The worst I can say is no.

Alrigthy, that just about it. Now go and have some fun!
